description: He suddenly collapsed and is not breathing.
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, start CPR, use AED
required_core_equipments: AED, Bag-Valve Mask, Oxygen source

description: He complained of chest pain and then suddenly collapsed.
intervention_first_5m: Assess responsiveness, Monitor vitals, Keep patient comfortable
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Cardiac monitor, gloves

case_name: Severe Chest Pain + Shortness of Breath
description: She is having severe chest pain and can’t breathe properly.
intervention_first_5m: Check ABC - give oxygen if SpO₂ < 94%
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

description: He fainted and is not waking up.
intervention_first_5m: Check responsiveness & pulse - Start CPR if pulse absent - Apply AED
required_core_equipments: AED, Bag-Valve Mask, Oxygen, Gloves

description: He said his heart felt irregular, then he fainted.
intervention_first_5m: Lay patient supine, give oxygen if SpO₂ < 94%, monitor ECG
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

description: He is complaining of heavy chest pressure and sweating a lot.
intervention_first_5m: Sit patient upright - give oxygen if SpO₂ < 94% - monitor vitals
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

description: He collapsed right after physical activity.
intervention_first_5m: Check responsiveness & breathing, start CPR, use AED
required_core_equipments: AED, Bag-Valve Mask, Oxygen source, gloves

description: She suddenly felt extremely tired and then collapsed.
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC - monitor vitals - keep patient supine
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

case_name: Loss of consciousness with chest discomfort
description: He had chest discomfort and then lost consciousness.
intervention_first_5m: Check responsiveness & breathing - Lay patient supine - Monitor vitals & be ready for CPR
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

description: I can't breathe something is stuck in my throat
intervention_first_5m: Encourage coughing if possible - Perform Heimlich maneuver - Start CPR if patient becomes unresponsive
required_core_equipments: Bag-Valve Mask, Gloves, Oxygen, Suction (if available)

description: I can’t catch my breath, I feel like I’m suffocating
intervention_first_5m: Check responsiveness & breathing - Give high-flow oxygen - Monitor vitals continuously
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Monitor, Bag-Valve Mask, Gloves

description: I feel like I can’t get enough air and my chest is tight
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC - Give oxygen - Keep patient calm and seated
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, monitor, gloves

description: He couldn't breathe then he passed out
intervention_first_5m: Check responsiveness & breathing - start CPR if no pulse
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, bag-valve mask, monitor, gloves

description: My child is breathing fast and making noisy sounds when inhaling
intervention_first_5m: Assess airway and breathing - Give oxygen - Keep child calm and sitting upright - Start CPR if unresponsive
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Bag-Valve Mask (pediatric), Gloves, Monitor

description: I suddenly can’t breathe and feel like I’m suffocating
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC - Give high-flow oxygen - Prepare for airway support - Start CPR if no pulse
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, bag-valve mask, monitor, gloves

description: I’m coughing a lot and spitting blood
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC - Keep patient upright or on side if vomiting blood - Monitor airway closely - Give oxygen
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Suction (if available), Bag-Valve Mask

case_name: Sudden shortness of breath at rest
description: Person suddenly can’t breathe while resting.
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC - give high flow oxygen - start CPR if no breathing or pulse - keep patient upright if possible - monitor VS
required_core_equipments: Oxygen supply with mask, Bag-Valve-Mask (BVM), Pulse oximeter, AED / Cardiac monitor

description: Someone almost drowned and can’t breathe!
intervention_first_5m: Ensure scene safety - Check ABC - Clear airway - Give high-flow oxygen - Assist breathing with BVM if needed - Start CPR if no breathing or pulse - Keep warm and monitor vital signs - Call for emergency help
required_core_equipments: Oxygen supply with non‑rebreather mask, Bag-Valve-Mask (BVM), Suction device, Pulse oximeter, AED / Cardiac monitor, Airway adjuncts (OPA/NPA), Cervical collar

description: My face is swelling and I can’t breathe properly
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, sit patient upright, give oxygen if breathing inadequate, administer Epinephrine, monitor airway and vital signs, prepare for CPR if unresponsive
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter, Epinephrine

description: I ate something and now I’m having trouble breathing and my lips are swelling
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, sit patient upright, administer Epinephrine IM, give oxygen if breathing is poor, monitor vital signs, prepare for CPR if patient loses consciousness
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter, Epinephrine

description: He was stung by a bee and now he's laying down struggling to stay conscious
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, lay patient flat on back with legs elevated if no spinal injury, administer Epinephrine IM if indicated, give oxygen if breathing inadequate, monitor airway and vital signs, prepare for CPR if unresponsive
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter, Epinephrine

description: I have a rash all over and I feel short of breath
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, sit patient upright, give oxygen if breathing labored, monitor vital signs
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter

description: I have hives, feel dizzy and my heart is racing
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, sit patient upright, give oxygen if breathing labored, monitor vital signs
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter

description: She can barely speak, coughing and says her throat is very tight
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, sit patient upright, administer Epinephrine IM if indicated, give oxygen if breathing inadequate, monitor airway closely, prepare for CPR if airway becomes blocked
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Gloves, Bag-Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter, epinephrine

description: He’s having a seizure and keeps shaking, he hasn’t woken up
intervention_first_5m: Protect patient from injury, place on side, support airway, prepare for ventilation if apnea occurs
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Monitor, Bag-Valve Mask, Gloves

description: She’s awake but very confused and not answering normally or He won’t wake up when we call his name
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABCD, support airway and breathing, give oxygen if needed, monitor vital signs
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Monitor, Bag-Valve Mask, Gloves

description: He suddenly grabbed his head saying it hurts badly, then collapsed
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABCD, provide high-flow oxygen if needed, monitor vital signs, position patient supine with legs elevated if tolerated, check blood glucose, prepare rapid transport to a hospital
required_core_equipments: Oxygen, Bag‑Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter

description: She fell and hasn’t responded or opened her eyes since
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, support airway and ventilation, stabilize head/neck if suspected trauma, give oxygen as needed
required_core_equipments: Gloves, Oxygen, Bag‑Valve Mask, Pulse oximeter, neck collar

description: He says suddenly he can’t see and seems very confused
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABCD, ensure airway is clear, keep patient at rest in a safe position, perform basic neurological observation, check vital signs, prepare for rapid transport to hospital
required_core_equipments: Gloves, VS monitor, pulse oximeter, glucometer

description: He suddenly can’t move his left arm or leg at all
intervention_first_5m: Assess level of consciousness, ensure airway is clear, position patient safely, keep patient at rest, monitor neurological status, prepare for rapid transport to the hospital
required_core_equipments: Gloves, VS monitor, pulse oximeter

description: She suddenly feels very dizzy and can’t keep her balance
intervention_first_5m: Assess level of consciousness, assist patient to sit or lie down safely, check vital signs, observe for neurological changes, prepare for transport if symptoms persist
required_core_equipments: Gloves, VS monitor, pulse oximeter

case_name: Sudden weakness or facial droop + slurred speech / arm weakness
description: His face is drooping, he can’t lift his right arm, and he’s slurring words
intervention_first_5m: Assess level of consciousness, ensure airway is clear, position patient safely, support limb, monitor neurological status, prepare for rapid transport to the hospital
required_core_equipments: Gloves, VS monitor, pulse oximeter

description: Someone is bleeding heavily from his leg, blood is pouring and won’t stop
intervention_first_5m: Directly compress bleeding with firm pressure and dressings, elevate limb if feasible, apply tourniquet if bleeding uncontrolled, reassess distal pulse, monitor for shock signs.
required_core_equipments: Gloves, pressure dressings, sterile gauze, tourniquet, pulse oximeter, blood pressure cuff, stethoscope.

case_name: Fall from height, unable to move
description: He fell from a high place and can’t move
intervention_first_5m: Ensure scene safety, assess ABC, stabilize spine with cervical collar and backboard, keep patient still, monitor vitals
required_core_equipments: Gloves, cervical collar, spinal backboard/immobilization straps, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

case_name: Head trauma with loss of consciousness
description: He hit his head and hasn’t woken up
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, support airway and breathing, stabilize cervical spine, check for bleeding, monitor for increased ICP, prepare rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, oxygen delivery system, BVM if needed, cervical collar, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: He was in a car crash and is having trouble breathing with chest pain
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, provide high-flow oxygen if hypoxic, monitor for flail chest/rib instability, support breathing, monitor vitals
required_core_equipments: Gloves, oxygen delivery system, cervical collar, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: He has a broken bone sticking out with blood coming out
intervention_first_5m: Control bleeding with direct pressure and dressings, splint fracture in position, monitor distal circulation, monitor vitals
required_core_equipments: Gloves, sterile gauze, splint materials, pressure dressings, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: His arm/leg is trapped under debris and looks crushed
intervention_first_5m: Stabilize limb, control external bleeding, monitor distal pulses, observe for shock, prepare for rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, sterile dressings, splint materials, pulse oximeter, BP cuff, stethoscope

description: He fell and his pelvis looks unstable, he can’t move properly
intervention_first_5m: Stabilize pelvis with binder or sheet, assess ABC, monitor for bleeding/shock, monitor vitals, prepare for transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, pelvic binder or large sheet, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

case_name: Severe burn over large body area
description: He has burns over a large part of his body
intervention_first_5m: Stop burning process, cool with clean water (avoid ice), cover with sterile non‑adhesive dressings, monitor ABC, prevent hypothermia, prepare for transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, sterile non‑adhesive dressings, clean water source, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: After the fall, he can’t move and seems numb from the waist down
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC first. Apply selective spinal immobilization if indicated. Avoid unnecessary movement, monitor vitals, prepare for rapid transport.
required_core_equipments: Gloves, cervical collar, spinal backboard/immobilization straps, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: He was in a motorcycle crash and he is unconscious
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, support airway and breathing, provide oxygen if needed, stabilize cervical spine, monitor vitals, prepare rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, oxygen delivery system, BVM if needed, cervical collar, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

case_name: Sudden severe shortness of breath with pink frothy sputum
description: He’s struggling to breathe, coughing up pink frothy sputum, looks very tired and sweaty
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, provide high-flow oxygen, keep patient sitting upright, monitor vitals, prepare for rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, oxygen delivery system, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: He’s having trouble breathing more than usual, using accessory muscles, looks tired and anxious
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, provide oxygen to maintain SpO₂ 88–92%, monitor vitals, assist with inhaler/nebulizer if available, prepare transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, oxygen delivery system, pulse oximeter, VS monitor, nebulizer if available

description: He’s sweating, shaking, confused and can’t talk properly, seems almost unconscious
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC. Check blood glucose. Give oral glucose ONLY if patient is conscious and able to swallow. If unresponsive, support ABC and request ALS. Monitor vitals. Rapid transport.
required_core_equipments: glucometer, oral glucose, pulse oximeter, oxygen PRN, BVM PRN

description: He’s been stabbed and bleeding heavily from his abdomen/chest/limb
intervention_first_5m: Apply direct pressure to control bleeding, assess ABC, monitor vital signs, prepare for rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, pressure dressings, pulse oximeter, VS monitor, tourniquet if needed

description: His arm/leg was cut off and is bleeding a lot
intervention_first_5m: Control bleeding with direct pressure and tourniquet if necessary, preserve amputated part in clean cool dressing, assess ABC, monitor vitals, prepare rapid transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, sterile gauze, tourniquet, pulse oximeter, VS monitor

description: He got hit in the face/eye, bleeding and can’t open his eye
intervention_first_5m: Assess ABC, cover eye with sterile dressing if needed, avoid pressure, monitor vitals, prepare transport
required_core_equipments: Gloves, sterile non‑adhesive dressings, pulse oximeter, VS monitor
